title: Mexican Navy ship crashes into New York City’s Brooklyn Bridge
byline: A huge Mexican Navy training ship has been damaged after crashing into New York City’s Brooklyn Bridge during a festive visit to the US.

title: Health Minster leaves for Switzerland to attend WHO Assembly
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, departed for Switzerland this morning to participate in the 78th annual World Health Assembly (WHA78) of the World Health Organization (WHO).

title: Rainfall above 100mm on the cards
byline: Rainfall exceeding 100 mm is expected in several parts of the island as the South-West monsoon conditions continue to strengthen over Sri Lanka, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Ontario court grants extradition of Sri Lankan gang leader arrested in Toronto
byline: An Ontario judge has granted the extradition of a Sri Lankan gang leader arrested in Toronto last year for his alleged role in a deadly attack on a rival gang near Paris in 2022.

title: SLPP urges President, Prime Minister to attend War Heroes’ Commemoration: Sagara Kariyawasam
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) is requesting President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya to attend the National War Heroes’ Commemoration Ceremony to be held tomorrow, SLPP General Secretary Sagara Kariyawasam said today.

title: Police officer arrested for drunk driving
byline: A police officer attached to the Ayithiyamalai police station in Batticaloa has been arrested for driving under the influence of alcohol, Police said.

title: Tariff hike proposed but rates still lower: CEB
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has assured that despite the proposed tariff adjustments for the second half of 2025, the electricity rates will still remain lower than they were at the beginning of the year.

title: Landslide warning issued for six districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) today issued early landslide warnings for six districts.

title: Mullivaikkal commemoration in Wellawatta disturbed
byline: A tense situation prevailed in Wellawatta this morning when a commemoration to mark the deaths of the Tamil civilians during the last phase of the war themed as the ‘Mullivaikkal Commemoration’ was disturbed by a group of people.

title: Building fire kills 17, injures others in southern India
byline: At least 17 people were killed and several injured in a fire that broke out at a building near the historic Charminar monument in Hyderabad city, southern India, officials said Sunday.

title: Pigeon keeper shot at and wounded in Bloemendhal
byline: A pigeon keeper in Sirisanda Sevana Flats at Bloemendhal was shot at by unidentified motorcyclist and sustained injuries this evening, the police said.

title: Traffic restrictions near Battaramulla due to War Heroes’ Commemoration
byline: Vehicular traffic will be restricted near the Battaramulla area tomorrow evening from 4.00 pm to 6.30 pm due to the National War Heroes’ Commemoration Ceremony, Police said.

title: SLPP urges President, PM to attend War Heroes’ Commemoration: Sagara Kariyawasam
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) is requesting President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya to attend the National War Heroes’ Commemoration Ceremony to be held tomorrow, SLPP General Secretary Sagara Kariyawasam said today.

title: Yevan David takes Sensational Spa Win
byline: Sri Lankan racing sensation Yevan David showcased his supreme talent with a superb win at the Spa Francorchamps circuit - venue of the Belgian Formula 1 Grand Prix in the first race of the second round of the 2025 Euroformula Open on Saturday.
